page.title: 06New Forest Snakes.
page.content: There are four different types of snakes in the New Forest.Although you may see one or two in the summer months they are not very common at all. { Adder}and{Viper}:This snake does have a venomous bite.It is identified by a dark zig-zag on the back of it.The average length is about 60cm. { Grass-snake}:Often mistaken for an Adder but is in fact very different!It grows to about 2m,and as a pale yellow colour around its neck.It is not venomous.{ { Smooth-snake}:Not very common.It has a blackish brownish stripe at each side of the head.It is not venomous. {Slow-worms}:not a snake infact, but they are mistaken for one.They are in reality leg less lizards.They are dull brown in colour.
